x-sap-shortText: Manages your purchase orders and purchase order related data.

info.title: Purchase Orders
info.description: In Concur Invoice, purchase orders are requests for a vendor to supply goods or services. This API provides methods to create a new purchase order, or view or update an existing purchase order.

OAuth2.description: To use this API, you need to get OAuth client credentials (client ID, secret, and geolocation) from SAP Concur, and be authorized to use the relevant scope. Refer to the full authentication information for more information.

post.description: Creates a purchase order and returns the status of the creation request.

parameters.name: purchaseOrder
parameters.description: The details of the purchase order.

put.description: Updates the specified purchase order and returns the status of the update request.

parameters.name: purchaseOrder
parameters.description: The details of the purchase order.

get.description: Retrieves information about the specified purchase order.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The identifier for the purchase order.

Description.description: A description of the line item.

ExpenseType.description: The expense type of the line item. A value must be supplied for either ExpenseType or AccountCode, but not both. This field is required if an AccountCode value is not supplied.

ExternalID.description: Required. A customer-supplied value that uniquely identifies the line item within the purchase order.

IsReceiptRequired.description: Indicates whether the line item requires a receipt. Format: true or false

LineNumber.description: Required. The line item number within the purchase order.

PurchaseOrderReceiptType.description: Purchase order ReceiptType of the line item. Accepted values are QUANTITY_RECEIPT or NONE. If a value is not provided, it will default to NONE. If you are using Concur Receiving and need to enter Goods Receipts against the resulting PO lines use QUANTITY_RECEIPT.

Quantity.description: Required. The quantity associated with the line item.

RequestedBy.description: The person who requests the goods in the line item of the purchase order.

RequestedDeliveryDate.description: The date the line item of the purchase order instructed the vendor to deliver the goods. Format: YYYY-MM-DD

SupplierPartID.description: Any number that might help to identify the line item. This could be a value such as the vendor's part number or even the manufacturer number.

Tax.description: Any tax that is associated with the line item.

UnitOfMeasureCode.description: The unit of measure code of the line item.

UnitPrice.description: Required. The price of each item of the line item.

VatAmount.description: This field has not been implemented by purchase request yet. Any data in this field will be ignored.

AmountWithoutVat.description: The net amount of the purchase order, excluding VAT.

CurrencyCode.description: Required. The 3-letter ISO 4217 currency code of the currency that is associated with the purchase order.

Description.description: A description of the purchase order.

DiscountPercentage.description: The discount from the vendor, if the discount terms are met.

DiscountTerms.description: The net discount terms that the vendor offers, when discounts apply.

ID.description: The unique identifier of the resource.

IsTest.description: If the purchase order is a test.

IsChangeOrder.description: If the purchase order has a change order or not.

LedgerCode.description: A code which indicates which company journal the Purchase Order is assigned to. Use "GET /purchase order/localizeddata" to translate the code into text.

Name.description: Required. A name for the purchase order.

NeededByDate.description: The date by which the purchase order must be fulfilled. Format: YYYY-MM-DD

OrderDate.description: Required. The date when goods were ordered. Format: YYYY-MM-DD

PaymentTerms.description: The net payment terms that have been set up with a vendor.

PolicyExternalID.description: Required. The external identifier of the policy that should be associated with the purchase order. The external Id is a property of the policy configuration screen. Clients will need to get these IDâ€™s from the Implementation team if using professional version. For standard version the value is always 'PO'

PurchaseRequestNumber.description: The related purchase request number that generated the purchase order.

ReceiptType.description: Deprecated, use the PurchaseOrderReceiptType at line item level instead.

RequestedBy.description: The person who requests the goods in the purchase order.

RequestedDeliveryDate.description: The date the purchase order instructed the vendor to deliver the goods. Format YYYY-MM-DD

Shipping.description: The total shipping cost for the purchase order.

ShippingDescription.description: A description of how the goods in the purchase order will ship. For example, via FedEx.

ShippingMethodKey.description: A code that represents the shipping method used by the vendor. Maximum length: 10 characters

ShippingTermsKey.description: A code that represents the shipping terms that the vendor offers. Maximum length: 10 characters

Status.description: The current status of the purchase order. Status should be either Closed or Transmitted. If a value is not provided, it will default to Transmitted.

Tax.description: The total tax for the purchase order.

VatAmountOne.description: This field has not been implemented by Purchase Request yet. Any data in this field will be ignored.

VatAmountTwo.description: This field has not been implemented by Purchase Request yet. Any data in this field will be ignored.

VatRateOne.description: This field has not been implemented by Purchase Request yet. Any data in this field will be ignored.

VatRateTwo.description: This field has not been implemented by Purchase Request yet. Any data in this field will be ignored.

VendorAddressCode.description: Required. The code that identifies the vendor's remit address for the purchase order.

VendorCode.description: Required. The code that identifies the vendor for the purchase order.

ErrorCode.description: A code that indicates why the purchase order was not processed successfully.

FieldCode.description: A code that indicates which field caused an issue. This code typically appears only when a field is being validated against a field of a form type. Format: LEVEL|CODE. The possible levels are: Header, ShipTo, BillTo, LineItem, Allocation.

LineItemExternalID.description: The external ID of a line item that caused an error. If the error is related to an allocation, this field indicates the external ID of the line item that the allocation is associated with, and also indicates the allocation that caused of the error.

Status.description: The result of processing the purchase order. Format: SUCCESS or FAILURE
